ProfileName: # Use this sheet to define settings for Server profile to be imported in OneView.
# If the row starts with '#' it will be ignored by the script
# For specific settings - read the comments on the first cell in the column for possible values

AssignmentType:
#The profile can be assigned to an empty server bay, a specific server, or unassigned.
# Valid values are:
#  unassigned
#  server
# bay
Enclosure:
#The blade enclosure resource containing the bay where the server profile will be assigned. 
#Only required if assignmentType is 'bay'
EnclosureBay: # The empty enclosure bay to assign the server profile.
Server:
# The server hardware resource where the new profile is to be applied.
# Usually get from Get-HPOVServer
ServerTemplate: # Server Template name if profile is created from this template
EnclosureGroup:
# Name of Enclosure Group
# Only required when AssignmentType is Unassigned.
Affinity:
# In a server profile, the Affinity control sets the remove-and-replace behavior for blade servers
# Accepted values are 
# Bay 
# BayAndServer
#  Default is 'Bay'.
FWEnable:
# Yes / No
# Enable Firmware Management.  
# Cannot be enabled with Server Hardware Type does not support Firmware Management (i.e. BL G7)
# If ' NO' , all the FW* settings will be ignored
FWMode:
# Define the mode a firmware baseline will be deployed.  Allowed values:
# FirmwareOnly - Updates the firmware without powering down the server hardware using using HP Smart Update Tools.
# FirmwareAndSoftware - Updates the firmware and OS drivers without powering down the server hardware using HP Smart Update Tools.
# FirmwareOffline - Manages the firmware through HP OneView. Selecting this option requires the server hardware to be powered down.
FWInstall:
# Using this parameter will force the bundled firmware components to install when the Server Profile is applied to a server.  
# This will downgrade firmware if the component firmware is newer than what the SPP Baseline contains.
# If omitted, then the connection is not bootable, and -priority is set to NotBootable.
# Yes / No
BIOSSettings:
# List of BIOS attributes you want to modify
# The syntax is :
#id=ID1;Value=Value1 | id=ID2;Value=Value2
#Note: Works only for Server Gen 8 or later
# To get a sense of ID and values ofr each setting, use the following techniques:
# $ThisSHT = Get-HPOVServerHardwareType -name " A given Hardware Type"
# This.SHT.BIOSSettings | select id, DependencyList
#Note: id and value must be in lowercase
# TO BE TESTED
BootOrder:
# Boot Order settings to be managed
# Gen7/8 BIOS Default Boot Order: CD|Floppy|USB|HardDisk|PXE
# Gen9 Legacy BIOS Boot Order: CD|USB|HardDisk|PXE
# Gen9 UEFI Default Boot Order: HardDisk
#
# Note: Gen9 UEFI boot values: HardDisk or PXE
BootMode:
# Specify the Gen9 Boot Envrionment.
# Sets the boot mode as one of the following:
# UEFI
# UEFIOptimized
# BIOS
# Default : BIOS
PXEBootPolicy:
# Controls the ordering of the network modes available to the Flexible LOM (FLB); for example, IPv4 and IPv6.
# Allowed values are:
# Auto
# IPv4 only
# IPv6 only
# IPv4 then IPv6
# IPv6 then IPv4
#
# Default: Auto
MACAssignment:
# Optional setting for MAC assignment.
# Possible values:
# Virtual
# Physical
#  Use Virtual if you need to specify a UserDefined value when using the New-HPOVServerProfileConnection helper CMDLET
WWNAssignment:
# Optional setting for WWN assignment.
# Possible values:
# Virtual
# Physical
#  Use Virtual if you need to specify a UserDefined value when using the New-HPOVServerProfileConnection helper CMDLET
SNAssignment:
# Optional setting for serial number and UUID assignment.
# Possible values:
# Virtual
# Physical
# UserDefined
HideUnusedFlexNics:
#This setting provides the ability to hide unused FlexNICs from the operating system.
# Yes / No
# Default is : Yes

Description: Profile for Bay 1 BL660C in Encl2
